turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Ramona.
turn.1: What is the role of the Native Americans in the film Ramona?
turn.2: Señora Moreno delays the sheep shearing, a major event on the rancho, awaiting the arrival of a group of Native Americans from Temecula, whom she always hires for that work.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The head of the Native American sheep shearers is Alessandro, the son of Pablo Assís, the chief of the tribe.
turn.5: What does he do in the film?
turn.6: Alessandro is the hero of the story—tall, wise, honest, and piously Catholic.
turn.7: Is he well liked by the other characters?
turn.8: Señora Moreno is also awaiting a priest, Father Salvierderra, from Santa Barbara, a saintly man who is honored by Native and Spanish alike.
turn.10: Señora Moreno awaits the priest so that the Native American workers can worship and make confession in her chapel before they go back to Temecula.
turn.11: Do they ever go back to Temecula?
turn.12: Alessandro quickly falls in love with Ramona and agrees to stay on at the Rancho.
